result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*NOT ON RECORD* Attorney Brett Tyler Kaehne appeared by phone for Ronald Alcid Bonich.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Discovery received.  Attorney Kaehne just received the recorded digital needs more time, request additional Scheduling Conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prior: 7131 Ashwood Lane, Wind Lake, WI 53185 United States

Cash bond posted
unsigned cash bond
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
No violent or abusive contact with the party/parties named in the bail bond. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements

3:01 PM Defendant Ronald Alcid Bonich appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brett Tyler Kaehne in court for Ronald Alcid Bonich. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Court rcvd' and rvd' State's motion to modify bond based on Day reporting. State requests an increase in cash bail. Defense requests Court admonish cash bond, higher cash bond not necessary. Court gives Deft warning Today, and leaves bond as is. Victim 1 is on phone. Court reviews other bond motion filed by Deft on 08/18 requesting to vacate no contact order with victim. Defense in agreement. State still concerned, bond was just modified a month ago, requests Court deny Deft's bond modification. Court modifies bond as requested by Deft and removes no contact order at residence of J.L.S.
